data.chText: 上诉；申诉
data.enText: a formal request to a court or to sb in authority for a judgement or a decision to be changed

data.chText: 提出上诉
data.enText: to lodge an appeal

data.chText: 提出上诉
data.enText: to file an appeal

data.chText: 上诉法庭 / 法官
data.enText: an appeal court/judge

data.chText: 上诉法庭 / 法官
data.enText: an appeals court/judge

data.chText: 不服禁赛3场令的申诉
data.enText: an appeal against the 3-match ban

data.chText: 吸引力；感染力；魅力
data.enText: a quality that makes sb/sth attractive or interesting

data.chText: 对大众的 / 广泛的 / 普遍的吸引力
data.enText: mass/wide/popular appeal

data.chText: 披头士乐队的感染力经久不衰。
data.enText: The Beatles have never really lost their appeal .

data.chText: 将要住在城市里对我没有什么吸引力。
data.enText: The prospect of living in a city holds little appeal for me.

data.chText: （尤指慈善机构或警方的）呼吁，吁请，恳求
data.enText: an urgent and deeply felt request for money, help or information, especially one made by a charity or by the police

data.chText: 通过电视呼吁为该慈善事业捐赠
data.enText: to launch a TV appeal for donations to the charity

data.chText: 默默恳求的目光
data.enText: a look of silent appeal

data.chText: 孩子的母亲在电视上恳切地要求儿子回家。
data.enText: The child's mother made an emotional appeal on TV for his return.

data.chText: 警方吁请公众保持镇静。
data.enText: The police made an appeal to the public to remain calm.

data.chText: 启发；打动
data.enText: an indirect suggestion that any good, fair or reasonable person would act in a particular way

data.chText: 我寄望能打动他的爱心。
data.enText: I relied on an appeal to his finer feelings.

data.chText: 上诉；申诉
data.enText: to make a formal request to a court or to sb in authority for a judgement or a decision to be changed

data.chText: 法庭判决他犯有四项谋杀罪，他表示要上诉。
data.enText: He said he would appeal after being found guilty on four counts of murder.

data.chText: 公司正对判决提出申诉。
data.enText: The company is appealing against the ruling.

data.text: In North American English, the form appeal (sth) (to sb/sth) is usually used, without a preposition:

data.enText: The company has ten days to appeal the decision to the tribunal.

data.text: 北美英语通常用appeal (sth) (to sb/sth)，不加介词：The company has ten days to appeal the decision to the tribunal.

data.chText: 有吸引力；有感染力；引起兴趣
data.enText: to attract or interest sb

data.chText: 想到要在雨中久等使人扫兴。
data.enText: The prospect of a long wait in the rain did not appeal.

data.chText: 设计得要雅俗共赏，老幼皆宜。
data.enText: The design has to appeal to all ages and social groups.

data.chText: 呼吁；吁请；恳求
data.enText: to make a serious and urgent request

data.chText: 民族主义领袖们呼吁保持冷静。
data.enText: Nationalist leaders appealed for calm.

data.chText: 我代表饥荒灾民吁请捐款。
data.enText: I am appealing on behalf of the famine victims (= asking for money) .

data.chText: 警方呼吁证人挺身而出。
data.enText: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.

data.chText: 组织者呼吁人群不要惊慌。
data.enText: Organizers appealed to the crowd not to panic.

data.chText: 启发；劝说；打动
data.enText: to try to persuade sb to do sth by suggesting that it is a fair, reasonable, or honest thing to do

data.chText: 他们需要激发他的正义感。
data.enText: They needed to appeal to his sense of justice.

means: (尤指慈善机构或警方的)呼吁，吁请，恳求

ex.chText: 她的美貌吸引了很多路人。
ex.enText: Her beauty attracted many passers-by.

ex.chText: 为什么吃剩的食物会招引苍蝇？
ex.enText: Why would leftover food attract flies?

ex.chText: 这是吸引新企业进入该地区的有效方式。
ex.enText: This is an effective way to attract new businesses to the area.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指客观上吸引他人的注意力，或把某人或某物吸引到某事物上来。

ex.chText: 这种设计吸引各个年龄段的人。
ex.enText: The design appeals to all ages.

ex.chText: 年轻妇女喜欢时装秀。
ex.enText: Fashion shows appeal to young women.

synonyms.bx: 指使人感兴趣，常后接介词 to。

ex.chText: 他落落大方的仪态令聚会上的每一个人为之倾倒。
ex.enText: His graciousness charmed everyone at the party.

ex.chText: 他们被当地人的好客吸引住了。
ex.enText: They were charmed by the hospitality of the local people.

ex.chText: 显然，她被乔治的周到体贴所吸引。
ex.enText: Obviously, she was charmed by George's thoughtfulness.

ex.chText: 孩子们热情的歌唱吸引了观众。
ex.enText: The children charmed the audience with their enthusiastic singing.

synonyms.bx: 指吸引或取悦某人以使其对自己产生好感。

ex.chText: 这类电影总是使他着迷。
ex.enText: This kind of movie has always fascinated him.

ex.chText: 穿越时光旅行的想法深深吸引着那个年轻人。
ex.enText: The idea of travelling through time fascinates the young man.

synonyms.bx: 指让人产生兴趣，通常含令人无法拒绝或摆脱的意味，不用进行时。

ex.chText: 当地的那个非政府环保组织恳请政府提供帮助。
ex.enText: That local environmental non-governmental organization pleaded for government help.

ex.chText: 那对双胞胎恳求苏珊留下。
ex.enText: The twins pleaded with Susan to stay.

ex.chText: 反对派领导人呼吁保持冷静。
ex.enText: Opposition leaders appealed for calm.

ex.chText: 你可以吁请董事会提供帮助。
ex.enText: You can appeal to the board for help.

ex.chText: 很多非政府组织都呼吁公众捐款。
ex.enText: Many non-governmental organizations have appealed to the public to donate money.

synonyms.bx: 指严肃、公开地请求给予帮助、信息、钱款等。

ex.chText: 她想冲到前男友面前乞求他原谅。
ex.enText: She wanted to run to her ex-boyfriend and beg his forgiveness.

ex.chText: 他跑到最近的教堂恳求帮助。
ex.enText: He ran to the nearest church and begged for help.

synonyms.bx: 指焦急、迫切地恳求，含有低三下四的意味。

ex.chText: 她乞求房东减少房租。
ex.enText: She implored the landlord to reduce the rent.

ex.chText: 约翰，我求你快帮她，要不然她就要破产了。
ex.enText: John, I implore you, help her now before she goes broke.

synonyms.bx: 指焦急或动情地乞求某事物，或恳求某人做或不做某事，有时用于文学作品中。

ex.chText: 村民请愿要求地方政府提供更便利的医疗服务。
ex.enText: Villagers petitioned the local government to provide more convenient medical services.

ex.chText: 政府官员不明白为什么居民要请愿反对修建那条新道路。
ex.enText: Government officials didn't understand why residents petitioned against the new road.

synonyms.bx: 通常指向政府或组织请愿。

ex.zh: 呼吁某人；对某人的呼吁；对某人有吸引力

tr: (law) a legal proceeding in which the appellant resorts to a higher court for the purpose of obtaining a review of a lower court decision and a reversal of the lower court's judgment or the granting of a new trial
example: their appeal was denied in the superior court

tr: attractiveness that interests or pleases or stimulates
example: his smile was part of his appeal to her

tr: request for a sum of money
example: an appeal to raise money for starving children
an entreaty to stop the fighting
an appeal to the public to keep calm
Invoke God in times of trouble
He invoked the law that would save him
I appealed to the law of 1900
The idea of a vacation appeals to me
The beautiful garden attracted many people

tr: take a court case to a higher court for review
example: He was found guilty but appealed immediately

value.def: If you appeal to someone to do something, you make a serious and urgent request to them.

example.ex: The Prime Minister appealed to young people to use their vote...
example.tran: 首相呼吁年轻人行使他们的投票权。

example.ex: He will appeal to the state for an extension of unemployment benefits...
example.tran: 他将呼吁国家延长领取失业救济金的时限。

example.ex: The United Nations has appealed for help from the international community.
example.tran: 联合国已经呼吁国际社会提供援助。

value.def: An appeal is a serious and urgent request.

example.ex: He has a message from King Fahd, believed to be an appeal for Arab unity...
example.tran: 法赫德国王传话给他，据信内容是呼吁整个阿拉伯世界团结起来。

example.ex: Romania's government issued a last-minute appeal to him to call off his trip.
example.tran: 罗马尼亚政府最后一刻恳请他取消行程。

value.def: An appeal is an attempt to raise money for a charity or for a good cause.

example.ex: ...an appeal to save a library containing priceless manuscripts...
example.tran: 为挽救存有珍贵手稿的图书馆的一次募捐

example.ex: This is not another appeal for famine relief.
example.tran: 这不是为赈济饥荒的又一次募捐。

value.def: If you appeal to someone in authority against a decision, you formally ask them to change it. In British English, you appeal against something. In American English, you appeal something.

example.ex: He said they would appeal against the decision...
example.tran: 他说他们将对该决议提出申诉。

example.ex: We intend to appeal the verdict...
example.tran: 我们打算对裁决提出上诉。

example.ex: Maguire has appealed to the Supreme Court to stop her extradition.
example.tran: 马圭尔已向最高法院提出上诉，要求停止对她的引渡。

value.def: An appeal is a formal request for a decision to be changed.

example.ex: Heath's appeal against the sentence was later successful...
example.tran: 希思对判决不服提出上诉，后来胜诉了。

example.ex: The jury agreed with her, but she lost the case on appeal.
example.tran: 陪审团同意她的说法，但在上诉时她败诉了。

value.def: If something appeals to you, you find it attractive or interesting.

example.ex: On the other hand, the idea appealed to him...
example.tran: 从另一方面来说，这个想法又使他很感兴趣。

example.ex: The range has long appealed to all tastes.
example.tran: 该系列长期受到各类人士的欢迎。

value.def: The appeal of something is a quality that it has which people find attractive or interesting.

example.ex: Its new title was meant to give the party greater public appeal...
example.tran: 新的党名意在使该党对公众具有更强的吸引力。

example.ex: Johnson's appeal is to people in all walks of life.
example.tran: 约翰逊广受各界人士欢迎。

trans: 上诉法院；英国最高法院(上议院除外)；(美国)上诉法院
情感诉求；情感訴求；情调；感性诉求；诉求
同 Court of Appeal；[法]上诉法院
上诉委员会；诉委员会；申诉委员会
